required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Extension Study to Protocol MD7108240: Pazopanib Eye Drops in Subjects With Neovascular Age-related Macular Degeneration

brief_summary.textblock: This is a two month study to allow continued treatment with pazopanib eye drops. Study may be extended to 5 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) and Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. SBP and DBP were recorded from Baseline up to 6 months. At screening and Baseline, if the single measured value of blood pressure was above 150 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) systolic or 95 mm Hg diastolic, then blood pressure measurement could not be repeated. If, the SBP was <80 or >140 mm Hg and DBP was <40 or >90 mm Hg, then measurement of BP was repeated. Three consecutive blood pressure readings that were less than 150 mmHg systolic and 95 mmHg diastolic were taken with each measurement separated by at least 1 hour.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Heart Rate Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate was measured over 6 months. Baseline value was recorded on Day 1. Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Heart rate measurement were repeated in case it was in range < 50 beats per minute (bpm) or >110 bpm.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Albumin and Hemoglobin Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1), Month 2, 5 and approximately up to Month 6
primary_outcome.description: Albumin and hemoglobin values were recorded at Baseline, Month2, and till follow-up (Month 6). Baseline was recorded on Day 1. Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP), Alanine Aminotransferases (ALT), and Aspartate Aminotransferases (AST) Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: ALP, ALT and AST values were measured over 5 months and till the follow-up period. Baseline value was recorded pre-dose Day 1. Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Basophils, Eosinophils, Lymphocytes, Monocytes, Platelets, and White Blood Cell Count Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. The above mentioned hematological parameters were recorded from Baseline up to 5 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Percentage of Basophils, Eosinophils, Lymphocytes, Monocytes, and Total Neutrophils Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Over here, the change is % Basophils at month x - % Basophils at Baseline. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. Percentage change in the hematological parameter mentioned above was recorded from Baseline up to 5 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Direct Bilirubin, Total Bilirubin, and Creatinine Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. Direct bilirubin, total bilirubin, and creatinine were recorded from Baseline up to 6 months

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Calcium, Chloride, Carbon di Oxide Equivalent Content, Glucose, Potassium, Sodium, and Urea Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN) Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline (Day 1) is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. Calcium, chloride, carbon di oxide equivalent content (CO2), glucose, potassium, sodium, and urea/blood urea nitrogen (BUN) was recorded from Baseline up to Follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Mean Corpuscular Volume (MCV) Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. MCV was recorded from Baseline up to Follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Intra-ocular Pressure Assessment Over Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. Intra-ocular pressure was recorded from Baseline up to Follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Blood Occult, Urine Glucose, Urine Ketones, and Urine Proteins by Dip Stick Analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months (up to follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: In this dipstick test, the level of blood occult and glucose, ketones, protein in urine samples were recorded as negative, trace, 1+, 2+, and 3+ (the plus sign increases with a higher level of glucose, ketones, or proteins in the urine: 1+=slightly positive, 2+=positive, 3+=high positive).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with ocular and non-ocular AEs and SAEs were separately recorded. An AE is an unfavorable change in the health of a participant, including abnormal laboratory findings, that happens during a clinical study or within a certain time period after the study has ended. This change may or may not be caused by the intervention being studied. An SAE is an adverse event that results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or extends a current hospital stay, results in an ongoing or significant incapacity or interferes substantially with normal life functions, or causes a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Medical events that do not result in death, are not life-threatening, or do not require hospitalization may be considered serious adverse events if they put the participant in danger or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the results listed above.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Visual Acuity of Potential Clinical Concern (PCI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuity was measured over 5 months and also during follow-up period. Visual acuity was measured using standardized early treatment of diabetic retinopathy study (ETDRS) visual acuity charts. Visual acuity measurement was performed by an examiner that had been appropriately trained. Screening, Month 2 and Month 5 data were considered as Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) data. A loss of greater than or equal to 15 letters in BCVA from Baseline was considered of PCI. Data for number of participants who met the criteria for PCI have been presented.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Pupil Examination of PCI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to follow-up (approximately 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Pupil abnormalities were of different types. Meibomian gland dysfunction was measured as obvious inspissation (debris). Mild injection, no trichiasis (lid thickening), or two step worsening was analyzed. Afferent pupillary defect, motility examination, PERRL, confrontation visual field was measured as a new definite abnormality. Left and right both eyes were examined.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Conjunctival Examination of PCI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to follow-up (approximately 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: A two step worsening in the conjunctival examination was considered a value of PCI. Participants were analyzed for conjunctival examination up to follow-up (6 months).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Anterior Chamber Examination of PCI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: A two step worsening in the anterior chamber examination was considered a value of PCI. The participants were examined for any anterior chamber abnormality. Fibrinous response and obvious aqueous haze were considered abnormalities related to anterior chamber examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Corneal Examination of PCI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: A two step change in any of the lens opacity categories was categorized as of PCI. Corneal epithelium was defined as abnormal when punctate keratopathy was measured as mild, moderate, severe; epithelial edema was measured as subtle epithelial haze, mild patchy microcystic changes, diffuse microcystic changes, and/or investigator determined abnormality. Stromal opacity/ edema was measured by investigator when stroma identifies opacity or edema. Corneal staining was measured as obvious (<=20) localized or diffuse punctate staining areas, severe localized or diffuse punctate staining. Participants were analyzed for any of the mentioned abnormality over 6 weeks (up to follow-up period).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Lens Opacity of PCI Using Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS) Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: A two step change in any of the lens opacity categories was considered a value of PCI. Aphakia (surgical removal of lens) or pseudophakia was noted if any. Stroma opacity or edema was measured by investigator when it was detected as edema or opacity in stroma.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Tear Films of PCI
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Tear film abnormalities were based on the clinical judgment of investigator. Tear film thickness was analyzed and it was reported whether the film was increased or decreased or was normal. Presence of debris or mucus was also reported. Other test were tear lake analysis and checking of discharge from eyes.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any Grade 2 Plus Worsening of Meibomian Gland Function
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Meibomian gland dysfunction was measured as obvious insipisation/debris, mild injection, no trichiasis or lid thickening; inspisation, debris, obvious injection, lid thickening, may have trsichiasis; or a two step worsening. Any 2+ worsening of Meibomian gland function was considered a value of PCI.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal (Dilated) Fundus Examination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Dilation of fundus was examined post dosing up to 6 months. Number of participants with abnormal change from Baseline indicating dilation of fundus of eye was reported. Change from Baseline was the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. The abnormalities were posterior vitreous separation, pale optic nerve, fluid in the posterior pole, drusen, thick arterio-venous changes, pigment changes, cystoids, macular edema, drying of posterior fluid or sub-retinal fluid, underlying central atrophy, and retinal pigment epithelial changes etc. Refraction measurement were determined at the screening and 2 month/5 month visits in order to determine BCVA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Screening Visit) in BCVA at Month 2 and 5
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (screening visit), Month 2, and Month 5
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in BCVA is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. BCVA at screening visit was used as statistical Baseline. Only data before post-dose intravitreal injection of Avastin/ Lucentis (IVT) has been presented. Arithmetic mean was presented as data values; however statistical analysis is based on means of observed case (OC) data. The screening was used as a Baseline visit that was within or at 14 days of Day 1. Screening visit BCVA values were used to perform statistical comparison at month 2 and 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Screening Visit) in Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) Central Subfield Over 5 Months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Screening visit) and up to 5 months
secondary_outcome.description: The OCT effect is a pharmacodynamics (PD) measure of daily repeated dosing of Pazopanib. The anatomic effects of pazopanib treatment were limited to investigator determined assessment of OCT central subfield retinal thickness due to heterogeneity of participant population and the low likelihood of utility of central reading center determination. The OCT equipment used was approved by central OTC reading center. OCT scans were collected at indicated time points and were evaluated by Investigator. Thus, grading of further secondary objectives was not performed as per the study team. Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. The screening was used as a Baseline visit that was within or at 14 days of Day 1. Screening visit BCVA values were used to perform statistical comparison at month 2 and 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Neo-vascular Size and Lesion Size Over Period
secondary_outcome.description: The analysis was planned to be performed up to 6 months; however, due to heterogeneity of the population and the low likelihood of the utility of the data, the anatomic effects of the pazopanib treatment in this treatment were limited to investigator determined assessment of OCT central subfield retinal thickness. Thus, the study team decided not to have DARC (central reading center) perform the grading for the secondary PD outcomes like lesion size and change with respect to time were not analyzed. Thus, data was not collected for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Lesion Types Over Period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with type of lesion were reported as determined by Investigator. Occult and minimally classic were the two types of lesions reported.

arm_group.description: eligible participants received 5 mg/ml Pazopanib eye drops three times daily (TID)
eligible participants received 2 mg/ml Pazopanib eye drops three times daily
eligible participants received 5 mg/ml Pazopanib eye drops once daily (QD)

intervention.description: 5 mg/ml TID, 2 mg/ml TID or 5 mg/ml QD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who participated in Phase IIa study MD7108240 and who did not experience AMD disease progression requiring rescue therapy during pazopanib treatment or require discontinuation of pazopanib eye drops for safety reasons
- Best-corrected ETDRS visual acuity in the study eye of 23 letters (20/320 or 4/63) or better at screening.
- QTcB or QTcF < 450msec; or QTc < 480msec in subjects with Bundle Branch Block.
- Subject is willing and able to return for all study visits, and is willing and able to comply with all protocol requirements and procedures.
- Subject is capable of giving written informed consent, which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the consent form. If the subject is unable to read the consent form due to visual impairment then the consent must be read to the subject verbatim by person administering the consent, a family member or legally acceptable representative. If the subject is unable to provide written informed consent due to visual impairment, then written informed consent on behalf of the subject must be provided by a legally acceptable representative. (Note: Consent by legally acceptable representative is allowed where this is in accordance with local laws, regulations and ethics committee policy.)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anterior segment and vitreous abnormalities in the study eye that would preclude adequate observation of the fundus for photographs, fluorescein angiography and OCT.
- Vitreous, subretinal or retinal hemorrhage in the study eye that is unrelated to AMD.
- Intraocular surgery in the study eye within 3 months of dosing.
- Use of topical ocular medications (other than pazopanib) in the study eye within 7 days of first dose of investigational product or expected use of topical ocular medications during the treatment period, with the exception of artificial tears.
- Current use of medications known to be toxic to the retina, lens or optic nerve (e.g. desferoximine, chloroquine/hydrochloroquine, chlorpromazine, phenothiazines, tamoxifen, nicotinic acid, and ethambutol).
- An unwillingness to refrain from wearing contact lenses starting from the screening visit, through the follow-up visit
- ALT or AST above the upper limit of normal or total bilirubin â‰¥ 1.5 times the upper limit of normal at baseline. Note: Laboratory tests outside of the normal range may be repeated at the discretion of the Investigator.
- Medical history or condition:
- Uncontrolled Diabetes Mellitus, with hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) > 10%.
- Myocardial infarction or stroke within 6 months of screening.
- Active bleeding disorder.
- Major surgery within 1 month of screening.
- Hepatic impairment.
- Uncontrolled hypertension, based on criteria provided in the protocol. Note: Initiation or adjustment of antihypertensive medications is permitted prior to study entry provided the referenced criteria are met.
- Use of prohibited medications listed in the protocol within the restricted timeframe relative to the first dose of study medication.
- A condition or situation which, in the opinion of the investigator, may result in significant risk to the subject, confound the study results or interfere significantly with participation.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was an extension study to protocol MD7108240 (NCT00612456). It was a multi-center, double-masked, randomized, parallel-group dose-ranging study of repeat topical ocular doses of pazopanib from 25 June 2008 to 9 September 2009. The study was conducted in 14 centers in the United States, Italy, and Australia.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Randomized participants without progression of age-related macular degeneration (AMD) and/or requiring rescue therapy during the 28-day treatment period in study MD7108240 (NCT00612456) were included in this study. A total of 42 participants were randomized in the study.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 milligram/milliliter (mg/mL) Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months.

group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Sex: Female, Male

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) and Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) Over Period
outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. SBP and DBP were recorded from Baseline up to 6 months. At screening and Baseline, if the single measured value of blood pressure was above 150 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) systolic or 95 mm Hg diastolic, then blood pressure measurement could not be repeated. If, the SBP was <80 or >140 mm Hg and DBP was <40 or >90 mm Hg, then measurement of BP was repeated. Three consecutive blood pressure readings that were less than 150 mmHg systolic and 95 mmHg diastolic were taken with each measurement separated by at least 1 hour.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least one dose of the study drug. Only those participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Calcium, Chloride, Carbon di Oxide Equivalent Content, Glucose, Potassium, Sodium, and Urea Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN) Over Period
measure.description: Change from Baseline (Day 1) is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. Calcium, chloride, carbon di oxide equivalent content (CO2), glucose, potassium, sodium, and urea/blood urea nitrogen (BUN) was recorded from Baseline up to Follow-up.
measure.population: Safety population. Only those participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Day 1) in Mean Corpuscular Volume (MCV) Over Period
outcome.description: Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. Baseline measurement was recorded at Day 1. MCV was recorded from Baseline up to Follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 1) and approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population. Only those participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Blood Occult, Urine Glucose, Urine Ketones, and Urine Proteins by Dip Stick Analysis
outcome.description: In this dipstick test, the level of blood occult and glucose, ketones, protein in urine samples were recorded as negative, trace, 1+, 2+, and 3+ (the plus sign increases with a higher level of glucose, ketones, or proteins in the urine: 1+=slightly positive, 2+=positive, 3+=high positive).
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months (up to follow-up)
outcome.population: Safety population. Only those participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Blood Occult, Urine Glucose, Urine Ketones, and Urine Proteins by Dip Stick Analysis
measure.description: In this dipstick test, the level of blood occult and glucose, ketones, protein in urine samples were recorded as negative, trace, 1+, 2+, and 3+ (the plus sign increases with a higher level of glucose, ketones, or proteins in the urine: 1+=slightly positive, 2+=positive, 3+=high positive).
measure.population: Safety population. Only those participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Number of participants with ocular and non-ocular AEs and SAEs were separately recorded. An AE is an unfavorable change in the health of a participant, including abnormal laboratory findings, that happens during a clinical study or within a certain time period after the study has ended. This change may or may not be caused by the intervention being studied. An SAE is an adverse event that results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or extends a current hospital stay, results in an ongoing or significant incapacity or interferes substantially with normal life functions, or causes a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Medical events that do not result in death, are not life-threatening, or do not require hospitalization may be considered serious adverse events if they put the participant in danger or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the results listed above.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: Number of participants with ocular and non-ocular AEs and SAEs were separately recorded. An AE is an unfavorable change in the health of a participant, including abnormal laboratory findings, that happens during a clinical study or within a certain time period after the study has ended. This change may or may not be caused by the intervention being studied. An SAE is an adverse event that results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or extends a current hospital stay, results in an ongoing or significant incapacity or interferes substantially with normal life functions, or causes a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Medical events that do not result in death, are not life-threatening, or do not require hospitalization may be considered serious adverse events if they put the participant in danger or require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the results listed above.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Visual Acuity of Potential Clinical Concern (PCI)
outcome.description: Visual acuity was measured over 5 months and also during follow-up period. Visual acuity was measured using standardized early treatment of diabetic retinopathy study (ETDRS) visual acuity charts. Visual acuity measurement was performed by an examiner that had been appropriately trained. Screening, Month 2 and Month 5 data were considered as Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) data. A loss of greater than or equal to 15 letters in BCVA from Baseline was considered of PCI. Data for number of participants who met the criteria for PCI have been presented.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population. Only those participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Visual Acuity of Potential Clinical Concern (PCI)
measure.description: Visual acuity was measured over 5 months and also during follow-up period. Visual acuity was measured using standardized early treatment of diabetic retinopathy study (ETDRS) visual acuity charts. Visual acuity measurement was performed by an examiner that had been appropriately trained. Screening, Month 2 and Month 5 data were considered as Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) data. A loss of greater than or equal to 15 letters in BCVA from Baseline was considered of PCI. Data for number of participants who met the criteria for PCI have been presented.
measure.population: Safety population. Only those participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Pupil Examination of PCI
outcome.description: Pupil abnormalities were of different types. Meibomian gland dysfunction was measured as obvious inspissation (debris). Mild injection, no trichiasis (lid thickening), or two step worsening was analyzed. Afferent pupillary defect, motility examination, PERRL, confrontation visual field was measured as a new definite abnormality. Left and right both eyes were examined.
outcome.time_frame: Up to follow-up (approximately 6 months)
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Pupil Examination of PCI
measure.description: Pupil abnormalities were of different types. Meibomian gland dysfunction was measured as obvious inspissation (debris). Mild injection, no trichiasis (lid thickening), or two step worsening was analyzed. Afferent pupillary defect, motility examination, PERRL, confrontation visual field was measured as a new definite abnormality. Left and right both eyes were examined.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Conjunctival Examination of PCI
outcome.description: A two step worsening in the conjunctival examination was considered a value of PCI. Participants were analyzed for conjunctival examination up to follow-up (6 months).
outcome.time_frame: Up to follow-up (approximately 6 months)
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Conjunctival Examination of PCI
measure.description: A two step worsening in the conjunctival examination was considered a value of PCI. Participants were analyzed for conjunctival examination up to follow-up (6 months).
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Anterior Chamber Examination of PCI
outcome.description: A two step worsening in the anterior chamber examination was considered a value of PCI. The participants were examined for any anterior chamber abnormality. Fibrinous response and obvious aqueous haze were considered abnormalities related to anterior chamber examination.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Anterior Chamber Examination of PCI
measure.description: A two step worsening in the anterior chamber examination was considered a value of PCI. The participants were examined for any anterior chamber abnormality. Fibrinous response and obvious aqueous haze were considered abnormalities related to anterior chamber examination.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Corneal Examination of PCI
outcome.description: A two step change in any of the lens opacity categories was categorized as of PCI. Corneal epithelium was defined as abnormal when punctate keratopathy was measured as mild, moderate, severe; epithelial edema was measured as subtle epithelial haze, mild patchy microcystic changes, diffuse microcystic changes, and/or investigator determined abnormality. Stromal opacity/ edema was measured by investigator when stroma identifies opacity or edema. Corneal staining was measured as obvious (<=20) localized or diffuse punctate staining areas, severe localized or diffuse punctate staining. Participants were analyzed for any of the mentioned abnormality over 6 weeks (up to follow-up period).
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Corneal Examination of PCI
measure.description: A two step change in any of the lens opacity categories was categorized as of PCI. Corneal epithelium was defined as abnormal when punctate keratopathy was measured as mild, moderate, severe; epithelial edema was measured as subtle epithelial haze, mild patchy microcystic changes, diffuse microcystic changes, and/or investigator determined abnormality. Stromal opacity/ edema was measured by investigator when stroma identifies opacity or edema. Corneal staining was measured as obvious (<=20) localized or diffuse punctate staining areas, severe localized or diffuse punctate staining. Participants were analyzed for any of the mentioned abnormality over 6 weeks (up to follow-up period).
measure.population: Safety population

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Lens Opacity of PCI Using Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS) Scale
outcome.description: A two step change in any of the lens opacity categories was considered a value of PCI. Aphakia (surgical removal of lens) or pseudophakia was noted if any. Stroma opacity or edema was measured by investigator when it was detected as edema or opacity in stroma.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Lens Opacity of PCI Using Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS) Scale
measure.description: A two step change in any of the lens opacity categories was considered a value of PCI. Aphakia (surgical removal of lens) or pseudophakia was noted if any. Stroma opacity or edema was measured by investigator when it was detected as edema or opacity in stroma.
measure.population: Safety population

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Tear Films of PCI
outcome.description: Tear film abnormalities were based on the clinical judgment of investigator. Tear film thickness was analyzed and it was reported whether the film was increased or decreased or was normal. Presence of debris or mucus was also reported. Other test were tear lake analysis and checking of discharge from eyes.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Tear Films of PCI
measure.description: Tear film abnormalities were based on the clinical judgment of investigator. Tear film thickness was analyzed and it was reported whether the film was increased or decreased or was normal. Presence of debris or mucus was also reported. Other test were tear lake analysis and checking of discharge from eyes.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Any Grade 2 Plus Worsening of Meibomian Gland Function
outcome.description: Meibomian gland dysfunction was measured as obvious insipisation/debris, mild injection, no trichiasis or lid thickening; inspisation, debris, obvious injection, lid thickening, may have trsichiasis; or a two step worsening. Any 2+ worsening of Meibomian gland function was considered a value of PCI.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Any Grade 2 Plus Worsening of Meibomian Gland Function
measure.description: Meibomian gland dysfunction was measured as obvious insipisation/debris, mild injection, no trichiasis or lid thickening; inspisation, debris, obvious injection, lid thickening, may have trsichiasis; or a two step worsening. Any 2+ worsening of Meibomian gland function was considered a value of PCI.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal (Dilated) Fundus Examination
outcome.description: Dilation of fundus was examined post dosing up to 6 months. Number of participants with abnormal change from Baseline indicating dilation of fundus of eye was reported. Change from Baseline was the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. The abnormalities were posterior vitreous separation, pale optic nerve, fluid in the posterior pole, drusen, thick arterio-venous changes, pigment changes, cystoids, macular edema, drying of posterior fluid or sub-retinal fluid, underlying central atrophy, and retinal pigment epithelial changes etc. Refraction measurement were determined at the screening and 2 month/5 month visits in order to determine BCVA.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal (Dilated) Fundus Examination
measure.description: Dilation of fundus was examined post dosing up to 6 months. Number of participants with abnormal change from Baseline indicating dilation of fundus of eye was reported. Change from Baseline was the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. The abnormalities were posterior vitreous separation, pale optic nerve, fluid in the posterior pole, drusen, thick arterio-venous changes, pigment changes, cystoids, macular edema, drying of posterior fluid or sub-retinal fluid, underlying central atrophy, and retinal pigment epithelial changes etc. Refraction measurement were determined at the screening and 2 month/5 month visits in order to determine BCVA.
measure.population: Safety population.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Screening Visit) in BCVA at Month 2 and 5
outcome.description: Change from Baseline in BCVA is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. BCVA at screening visit was used as statistical Baseline. Only data before post-dose intravitreal injection of Avastin/ Lucentis (IVT) has been presented. Arithmetic mean was presented as data values; however statistical analysis is based on means of observed case (OC) data. The screening was used as a Baseline visit that was within or at 14 days of Day 1. Screening visit BCVA values were used to perform statistical comparison at month 2 and 5.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (screening visit), Month 2, and Month 5
outcome.population: Efficacy population included all participants in safety population who have classic choroidal neovascularization present as detected by fluorescein angiography in the previous screening visit.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Change From Baseline (Screening Visit) in BCVA at Month 2 and 5
measure.description: Change from Baseline in BCVA is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. BCVA at screening visit was used as statistical Baseline. Only data before post-dose intravitreal injection of Avastin/ Lucentis (IVT) has been presented. Arithmetic mean was presented as data values; however statistical analysis is based on means of observed case (OC) data. The screening was used as a Baseline visit that was within or at 14 days of Day 1. Screening visit BCVA values were used to perform statistical comparison at month 2 and 5.
measure.population: Efficacy population included all participants in safety population who have classic choroidal neovascularization present as detected by fluorescein angiography in the previous screening visit.

measurement_list.measurement: Since only 1 participant was analyzed, SD will not be applicable.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Screening Visit) in Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) Central Subfield Over 5 Months
outcome.description: The OCT effect is a pharmacodynamics (PD) measure of daily repeated dosing of Pazopanib. The anatomic effects of pazopanib treatment were limited to investigator determined assessment of OCT central subfield retinal thickness due to heterogeneity of participant population and the low likelihood of utility of central reading center determination. The OCT equipment used was approved by central OTC reading center. OCT scans were collected at indicated time points and were evaluated by Investigator. Thus, grading of further secondary objectives was not performed as per the study team. Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. The screening was used as a Baseline visit that was within or at 14 days of Day 1. Screening visit BCVA values were used to perform statistical comparison at month 2 and 5.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Screening visit) and up to 5 months
outcome.population: Pharmacodynamic subpopulation included participants that were analyzed for PD outcome measures. Only the participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.description: The OCT effect is a pharmacodynamics (PD) measure of daily repeated dosing of Pazopanib. The anatomic effects of pazopanib treatment were limited to investigator determined assessment of OCT central subfield retinal thickness due to heterogeneity of participant population and the low likelihood of utility of central reading center determination. The OCT equipment used was approved by central OTC reading center. OCT scans were collected at indicated time points and were evaluated by Investigator. Thus, grading of further secondary objectives was not performed as per the study team. Change from Baseline is the value at indicated time point minus the Baseline value. The screening was used as a Baseline visit that was within or at 14 days of Day 1. Screening visit BCVA values were used to perform statistical comparison at month 2 and 5.
measure.population: Pharmacodynamic subpopulation included participants that were analyzed for PD outcome measures. Only the participants available at the time of assessment were analyzed.

measurement_list.measurement: No SD can be calculated for one participant analyzed.
No SD can be calculated for one participant analyzed.

outcome.title: Change in Neo-vascular Size and Lesion Size Over Period
outcome.description: The analysis was planned to be performed up to 6 months; however, due to heterogeneity of the population and the low likelihood of the utility of the data, the anatomic effects of the pazopanib treatment in this treatment were limited to investigator determined assessment of OCT central subfield retinal thickness. Thus, the study team decided not to have DARC (central reading center) perform the grading for the secondary PD outcomes like lesion size and change with respect to time were not analyzed. Thus, data was not collected for this outcome measure.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 weeks
outcome.population: PD population was planned for analysis of this outcome; however, Data was not collected for this outcome measure.

measure.description: The analysis was planned to be performed up to 6 months; however, due to heterogeneity of the population and the low likelihood of the utility of the data, the anatomic effects of the pazopanib treatment in this treatment were limited to investigator determined assessment of OCT central subfield retinal thickness. Thus, the study team decided not to have DARC (central reading center) perform the grading for the secondary PD outcomes like lesion size and change with respect to time were not analyzed. Thus, data was not collected for this outcome measure.
measure.population: PD population was planned for analysis of this outcome; however, Data was not collected for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Lesion Types Over Period
outcome.description: Number of participants with type of lesion were reported as determined by Investigator. Occult and minimally classic were the two types of lesions reported.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months
outcome.population: Safety population.

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months and were followed-up for 7-14 days after the last dose of the study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Lesion Types Over Period
measure.description: Number of participants with type of lesion were reported as determined by Investigator. Occult and minimally classic were the two types of lesions reported.
measure.population: Safety population.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs and SAEs were collected approximately up to 6 months
reported_events.desc: Safety Population was used to collect AE and SAE data

group.title: 5 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months.

group.title: 2 mg/mL TID
group.description: Eligible participants received 2 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops three times daily for a treatment period of five months.

group.title: 5 mg/mL QD
group.description: Eligible participants received 5 mg/mL Pazopanib eye drops once daily for a treatment period of five months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
